attributes.action: Stop more parking meters going up around the outskirts of Cheltenham
attributes.additional_details:
Cheltenham Parking Review - West: West End, Lansdown & Railway

Current Stage: Stage 3 - Statuary consultation - (May 2016)

They are focused on the plans round the railway lines but have not made people aware that they have also proposed meters from parabola road, Overton park road right though to the Lansdown roads. 
Just another way for them to squeeze money out of shoppers who are now more likely to visit the out of town shopping centres to do the Christmas shopping etc
attributes.background:
Yet more parking meters are being added to the outskirts of Cheltenham town making it harder for shoppers and commuters. 
They say its to help residents but it also puts strain on the businesses that are already struggling to get the foot fall they need.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Your local council also has a petitions process - you can find out more about it here:

http://www.gloucestershire.gov.uk/petitions
